info.description: ClubManage is a backend club management application built to help students organize their involvements in multiple organizations. Club admins and members can create events with other organizations and add associated tasks. The ClubManage API specifies the expected functionality of the backend.
info.title: ClubManage API

post.description: User makes account during sign-in, returns user info

get.description:
Homepage of an user account.
Return user's clubs, events, tasks

After user searches for clubs to add. 
Return all clubs from database and their simplified information.

post.description: Admin creates a new club in the database. Return club information.

get.description: Find a club by club id.

delete.description: Admin deletes club. Returns club information.

post.summary: Request to join a club (from user)
post.description: User requests to join a club. Return request info (for joining club)
Admin accepts or declines request and sets user type. The club information is returned in data if successful.

error.example: Request not found, Cannot change request already accepted/denied

post.description: Explicitly add a user to club given user ID.
post.summary: Add user (by user id) to Club

post.description: Create a new event for a club.
Add another club to manage the event and for collaboration between clubs on a event.

get.description: Get an event based on the event ID. Returns the event's information as well as the info of clubs, tasks, and users associated with the event.

delete.description: Delete an event based on the event ID. Returns the deleted event's information as well as the info of clubs, tasks, and users associated with the event.

post.description: Edit an event by ID. Only name, date, description, and budget can be changed.
Invite a user to a event
Create a new task for a event

delete.description: Delete a task for a event

post.description: Assign a user to a task
Remove a club from a user and a user from a club (dissociation). Type of user in request must be "member" or "admin". Returns a user's information for response.

get.description: Admin of a club views the join requests of a club.

message.example: I would like to join the karate club please!
